_comment: Created by ianb on 20/03/2015 10:58:03 using v2.5
title: How does the rate of babies admitted to a neonatal unit soon after birth vary over time?
analysis_commentary: The graph captures the number of full-term babies (gestation greater than 36 weeks) admitted within 28 days of birth to a neonatal unit, expressed as a percentage of all full-term births. The rate has increased slightly from 6 admissions per 100 full term births in 2011 to 6.1 in 2012. While both these figures represent a substantial increase compare with the rate of 5.1 per 100 full term biths in 2010, that number was calcaulted based only on the 135 trusts that submitted data in 2010 - as opposed to 161 trusts submitting data in 2012 - so many not be directly comparable.
